page.title: 03ARMED FORCES IN DEERNESS
page.content: 1985 is the sixtieth anniversary of the formation of{Royal Observer Corps in Britain. The role of the original members was spotting and identifying aircraft. In the late fifties this was changed to include{detection and {monitoring of nuclear fallout.}At this time the United Kingdom warning and monitoring organisation was extended to include Orkney and Shetland. {Underground posts}were sited in Deerness Kirkwall and Stromness. {Primary use}of Royal Observer Corps is public warning of air attack and approach of nuclear fallout and help should nuclear warfare ever occur. Corps in Orkney consist of 33 highly trained observers who give freely of their{spare time}and whose main aim is to serve their country should the need ever arise.
